intro: Baissea borneensis, commonly known as the Bornean baissea, is a flowering plant native to the island of Borneo. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes coffee and gardenias, and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows as an evergreen shrub or small tree, often found in lowland and hill forest areas. Its leaves are elliptical,革质 (leathery), and have a smooth texture, while its flowers are usually white or pale pink. Baissea borneensis is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and limited distribution.
